item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Those who dance are considered insane by those who cannot hear the music." -- George Carlin

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "If it’s true that our species is alone in the universe, then I’d have to say the universe aimed rather low and settled for very little." -- George Carlin

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Some people see things that are and ask, Why? Some people dream of things that never were and ask, Why not? Some people have to go to work and don't have time for all that." -- George Carlin

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "No good deed goes unpunished." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The good ended happily, and the bad unhappily. That is what Fiction means." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is no sin except stupidity." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "One should always play fairly when one has the winning cards." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde (attributed to)
item.description: "Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go." -- Oscar Wilde (attributed to)

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Art is the only serious thing in the world. And the artist is the only person who is never serious." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every woman is a rebel." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Punctuality is the thief of time" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Baba Ram Dass
item.description: "The quieter you become, the more you can hear." -- Baba Ram Dass
